Reviews.Title: seems pretty good so far
Reviews.Author: ladylex "bm265"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 2 weeks so far, and I like it. It has a lot of scene settings, but doesn't seem to have one specifically for indoor pictures, which seems a bit strange. The LCD screen is only 2.5" but I knew that when I bought the camera. I also noticed that when I was facing the sun the LCD screen got a white vertical line through it. I looked at the digital manual that came with the camera, and it claimed that is normal. None of my other digital cameras did that. The white line didn't show up in the picture though. I am impressed with all the settings and editing capabilities this camera has. You can adjust the colors of your picture, edit them, adjust the brightness, and other things even without uploading them to your computer. I've never really used photo editing software much anyway, so maybe I don't know what I'm missing. I just thought that was very neat to be able to do all that. It also has onscreen help for making adjustments for things like low light or bright light conditions, reducing camera shake, and as I mentioned adjusting colors. I think this is another very useful feature of this camera. This camera uses digital image stabilization, which from what I know isn't quite as good as optical image stabilization. It has a rechargeable lithium ion battery, so it's pretty thin and light, fits in my purse even easier than my other digital cameras that used AA batteries. I noticed with a previous Samsung camera I owned that it started to put little white spots on pictures I took so I wound up returning it. I'm hoping this one won't develop that flaw. Samsung is one brand of digital camera Consumer Reports gives generally high marks to, so that is why I gave Samsung another chance with this camera. I will edit this review if I get any problem with it. I'd really probably give this camera 4 1/2 stars if that was an option.

Reviews.Title: Better than SL30
Reviews.Author: Scott Roberts
Reviews.Content: [update edit: I initially gave this 5 stars.  Although I do not see anything wrong in my initial review text below, we have been very disappointed with it after more use.  Part of the problem may be that we also have a $189 Panasonic Lumix DMC ZS1 that it is much better in quality but over 2 times the price.  We're giving this one away and going with one $50 more, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP3.  I strongly recommend pre-viewing cameras in local stores and get the one that you like the most that is within your budget. Cameras in this price range may be best for young children who might break it.]The are 2 big pluses for the Samsung SL50 over the SL30:1) Wide angle lens of 27 mm verses the standard 35 mm of the SL30.2) Lithium battery pack verses the 2 AA of the SL30.The wider angle allows more people to be in a group shot. Most personal cameras are heading this way.  In tight rooms and at restaurant tables, it is a big plus.  To get pictures to look like a traditional 35 mm lens, you can zoom in a little.  Some wide angle cameras are 25 mm, which causes a little too much fish-eye if you don't zoom.  I think the 27 mm of the SL50 is the best trade-off between what the average user needs and not having too much fish-eye.  Many amateurs stand too far away from their subject and end up with as much wall and floor in their picture as people.  So 27 mm means you need to stand closer or zoom a little. Again, this is almost always a plus.The optics of the SL50 allow you to get 29% closer than the SL30 (135 mm verses 105 mm) when zooming in on long distance subjects even though the ratings are 5x verses 3x zoom (which makes it sounds like 66% more).  This is because the SL50 starts with a wider field of view.Do not be put off by the 10 MP in comparison to 12 MP.  Computer screens can't utilize more than 2 MP. It's unfortunate most cameras these days are limiting the ability to have 1 MP and 2 MP pictures and putting the default at 12 MP. Most people do not realize they need to change the settings to 2 MP so that the picture can be taken, viewed, transferred, and edited much faster.

Reviews.Title: Very average...
Reviews.Author: J. Martin
Reviews.Content: First off, let me state that I'm no professional photographer, I am fairly technical and have owned a few digital cameras in the past, probably well within this product's target demographic.It's a very nice camera, digital screen looks great, I've owned it for a little over a month and the battery has lasted through summer vacations with up to 12 hours of use without charging, and the charge isn't even below 50%. Pictures taken in well-lit places look really good, the less light you have, the worse the pictures seem to get, it doesn't perform very well at all in low-light with any of the automatic settings, and I don't know enough about cameras to manually tweak them.Probably one of the better cameras in the sub-$100 price range.Pros:Small, lightweight, easily fits in a shirt or pants pocketPictures taken in daylight, or well-lit areas look greatBattery last a whileIncludes PC transfer cable and software, some cameras I've bought in the past, buying the cable was separateCons:Horrible pictures in low-light settingsNo viewfinder, screen view onlyProprietary rechargeable battery...mine's working great but eventually it'll wear out, and they aren't that cheap

Reviews.Title: It's a good camera!
Reviews.Author: Tahmay
Reviews.Content: I got a Panasonic for my anniversary and 3 days later lost it at a football game. I was about to go out of town and needed to get a good, yet affordable camera quick, so I purchased the Samsung. It is a good compact camera for the price. Pros- Good battery life and picture quality Cons- Having to go into the "menu" to switch to video, it's a bit of a pain as well as when you are using the video feature and zoom in it cuts out the audio as you are zooming.

Reviews.Title: Decent Point & Shoot Camera for Under $100
Reviews.Author: ottomatt
Reviews.Content: This camera is mediocre overall.  It has good photo quality in well lighted situations but performs poorly in low-light instances.  The camera is a nice compact size and has a comfortable weight.  The LCD screen is very good, but there is no viewfinder to use as an alternative to the LCD.  The menu options are sufficient but are not that plentiful.  It is fairly annoying that in order to record videos with the camera that you must always access the menu screen to do so.  The flash is fairly bright, and will most certainly help a low-light situation if you are shooting the photo in a small area (for example a bedroom or smaller in terms of size) but the flash will not help much for a photo in a vast or open area (for example a field).  The camera works with SD memory cards, and I have personally used a 16GB SDHC card with the camera with no issues.  Most of the other features of the camera are standard on most/all digital cameras and therefore I will not discuss them, for more information about these features please check the product specifications.  The camera is a decent entry in the small, point & shoot categories.  The camera performs great in well lighted situations but does poorly in most low light situations.  If you get a good deal on this camera then it is a good purchase, and you will almost certainly be satisfied.-Matt

Reviews.Title: not bad but
Reviews.Author: Baris Taze
Reviews.Content: It is under my expectation. Once you shoot a pic, it takes more than a few seconds to respond. It reads something like "processing" for a while and you have to wait for your second shot. It doesn't do a good job under fairly low light. Not satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "Sam"
Reviews.Content: For the price its a great deal.  Takes pictures really fast. Video is fantastic.  I would recommend this  samsung camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Tessi D.
Reviews.Content: I've had my Samsung camera since 2009 and it's still running just as well as the first day I got it. It's definitely not for proffessional pics, but it takes great snapshots. The voice recording feature is helpful and does a good recording. I've noticed that in video mode the sound cuts out when I use the zoom, but overall, this is a very good quality camera.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Ahmed Dabour
Reviews.Content: nice camera for the price its amazing u cant beat that for that price its really a good deal i would recommended to anybody that is not really looking for something pro

Reviews.Title: Defective Image Sensor
Reviews.Author: Luhan
Reviews.Content: My Samsung SL50 has many really great features.  It also features a low-grade image sensor.  Viewing any image at a 1:1 looks 'grainy' - even at low ISO settings.  Expanding the image further shows very uneven brightness levels where the color should be totally even.  Also, there are lots of totally black and totally white pixels (the 'salt and pepper' effect).Basically, for the low price you get a low grade image.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Doug K
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for our daughter for Christmas.  We bought this camera, not based on the reviews, but on a prior Samsung camera.  This camera is easy to set up and takes pictures just as good or better than my wife's 35mm film camera.  I love that it has a lithium battery, which lasts a longer than AA's.  While it may not be the camera for the professional, this camera will serve the general picture taker well.  I would not hesitate to buy another Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Camera
Reviews.Author: gradlife2012
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera today and I took tons of picture with it. The camera took great pictures in a pitch black room. It took good pictures in daylight as well. I am not sure what the others are talking about it being bad in low light. Of course its not a professional camera but it does more than get the job done. It has tons of settings and features. The key to good picture is pressing the shudder button halfway down first to allow the lens to focus then press it down completely to take the photo.

Reviews.Title: A Waste
Reviews.Author: Richard C whitesell
Reviews.Content: I have purchase this camera twice, once in July and again at the beginning of November and while I like its size, the view screen on both the cameras have gone out and so camera cannot be used.On the first one, from the middle to the left side is streaked black.  I contacted Samsung under the warrantee and was told that I must have hit it to damage and so not covered.  Since I had been using a soft case to protect it, thought maybe they were rightOn the second, there is a quarter size black spot with streaks with the remaining screen being grey.  I have had this one in a hard case and know that I did not hit it.A waste of money on 2 camera's, won't go for a third.

Reviews.Title: Evaluación calidad-precio
Reviews.Author: Enriquillo Ramos
Reviews.Content: La cámara no tiene calidad de definición y el enfoque es muy deficiente.El flash no mide adecuadamente en distancias de mas de 3 metros.Es un producto malo.

ProductInfo.Features:
If you prefer still shots to movies but want to leave your options open the SL50 is right for you.
No one has a bad side with SL50's Perfect Portrait system.
Say you've got about 2,000 photos stored on your E65 and you're looking for one in particular.
When we engineered the Samsung SL50 to be bright, we meant it in both senses of the word.
Even the tiniest shake can ruin your shot. The SL50's Digital Image Stabilization solves that.
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung SL50 10.2 MP Digital Camera with 5X Optical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD Display (Black)
